page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT Pentney & Narboro
page.content:
Several small businesses exist locally employing a few workers, agriculture being the most important of these. Others include engineering, a petrol station, public house, wrought iron foundry, builders, and local shops.
Most of the working population travel to King's Lynn, where they are employed in a large range of jobs mostly in factories. Others work in banks, offices and shops. The local R.A.F. station at Marham employs some villagers on a civilian basis whilst some R.A.F. personnel live locally.
Others are self-employed in many capacities e.g: Caterers, Newsagents, Horse breeders, Funeral Directors, Market traders and Insurance brokers. A few professional people include a Doctor and a Solicitor.
